item.description:
Leland Kinsey's new collection of linked narrative poems, The Immigrant's Contract (Godine, 2008), tells an American story of immigration and acculturation, an foreign identity becoming a native. Should be a good reading, I encourage everyone to come!

"[This book] is the most masterful and engaging story of what it means to be an immigrant from America that I've ever read." – Howard Frank Mosher author of On Kingdom Mountain

"Limber with history, ripe with life, plus the splendors of exactitude, this magnificent narrative poem is Leland Kinsey's richest to date. I pored over it." – Edward Hoagland
item.name: Reading by poet Leland Kinsey
